announcements.title: Welcome to Fountain!
announcements.message: New onboarding portal is now live. Check out our updated resources section.

faq.question: How do I access my email and company accounts?
faq.answer: You should have been provided access to your email account, and provided a link to slack. If you haven't received these for whatever reason please contact Daniel Raphael (Daniel@fountain.net).

faq.question: Where can I find information about benefits?
faq.answer: Benefits information is available in the Employee Handbook section under Essential Resources. You can also contact HR at hr@fountain.net for specific questions.

faq.question: What should I do on my first day?
faq.answer: On your first day, you'll complete new hire paperwork, set up your accounts, review the employee handbook, and meet with your manager. Check the First Day Checklist section and select your role (NPs, RNS, CS, or MAs) to see role-specific tasks.

faq.question: How do I request software access?
faq.answer: Submit software access requests through the Technology & Tools section. You can also contact IT Support directly at it-support@fountain.net.

faq.question: Who is my onboarding buddy?
faq.answer: Your onboarding buddy will be introduced to you on Day 1. They're an experienced team member who can answer questions and help you navigate your first weeks.

faq.question: Where can I find training materials for my role?
faq.answer: Visit the First Day Checklist section and click on your role button (NPs, RNS, CS, or MAs) to access role-specific day one tasks and training materials.

faq.question: How do I set up direct deposit?
faq.answer: You can set up direct deposit through Gusto. Log in to your Gusto account and navigate to the Payroll section to add your bank account information. If you need assistance, contact HR at hr@fountain.net.

faq.question: What's the dress code?
faq.answer: Fountain follows a business casual dress code. For remote work, maintain a professional appearance during video calls. When in doubt, it's better to be slightly overdressed than underdressed.

faq.question: How do I request time off?
faq.answer: Time off requests should be submitted through Gusto. Log in to your account, navigate to Time Off, and submit your request. Make sure to check with your manager about team coverage before submitting.

faq.question: Where can I find my employee ID number?
faq.answer: Your employee ID number can be found in your Gusto account under your profile information, or in your welcome email. You can also contact HR at hr@fountain.net if you need assistance locating it.

faq.question: What are the company holidays?
faq.answer: Company holidays are listed in the Employee Handbook under Essential Resources. You'll also receive notifications about upcoming holidays through company communications.

faq.question: How do I access my benefits information?
faq.answer: Benefits information is available in Gusto under the Benefits section. You can also find detailed information in the Employee Handbook. For specific questions, contact HR at hr@fountain.net.

faq.question: What should I do if I have technical issues?
faq.answer: For technical issues, contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net. For urgent matters, you can also reach out to Daniel Raphael on Slack. Include details about the issue and any error messages you're seeing.

faq.question: What are Fountain's contractor policies and requirements?
faq.answer: Detailed information about contractor policies, including payment terms, work expectations, and contractor responsibilities, can be found in the Fountain Contractor Policies document. This document is available in the Essential Resources section and is required reading for all contractors. For specific questions, contact HR at hr@fountain.net.

faq.question: What professional standards am I expected to follow?
faq.answer: Fountain maintains high professional standards for all team members. The Fountain Professional Standards document outlines expectations for conduct, communication, patient care, and professional behavior. This document is available in the Essential Resources section and should be reviewed on your first day. All team members are expected to adhere to these standards.

faq.question: How do I access the systems and tools I need for my role?
faq.answer: The Systems Doc provides comprehensive information about all systems, tools, and platforms used at Fountain, including access instructions and setup procedures. This document is available in the Essential Resources section under Tools & Systems. If you need help accessing specific systems, contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net.

faq.question: What is my status as a contractor at Fountain?
faq.answer: As a contractor, your relationship with Fountain is governed by the terms outlined in the Fountain Contractor Policies document. This document covers your contractor status, payment structure, work expectations, and other important details. Review this document carefully and contact HR at hr@fountain.net if you have questions about your contractor status.

faq.question: What are the communication standards I should follow?
faq.answer: Professional communication standards are detailed in the Fountain Professional Standards document. This includes guidelines for patient communication, team communication, documentation requirements, and professional etiquette. All team members must follow these standards to ensure consistent, high-quality service delivery.

faq.question: Where can I find information about the software and platforms I'll be using?
faq.answer: The Systems Doc contains detailed information about all software, platforms, and tools used at Fountain, including login procedures, system requirements, and usage guidelines. This document is regularly updated and can be found in the Essential Resources section. For technical setup assistance, contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net.

faq.question: What happens if I don't follow the professional standards?
faq.answer: All team members are expected to adhere to the Fountain Professional Standards. Failure to meet these standards may result in corrective action. The Professional Standards document outlines expectations and consequences. If you have questions about specific standards or situations, contact HR at hr@fountain.net for clarification.

faq.question: How often are contractor policies updated?
faq.answer: Contractor policies may be updated periodically to reflect changes in company practices or legal requirements. The Fountain Contractor Policies document shows the last updated date. You'll be notified of significant policy changes. Always refer to the most current version of the document in the Essential Resources section.

faq.question: What systems do I need to set up on my first day?
faq.answer: The Systems Doc provides a complete list of systems and tools you'll need to access, along with setup instructions. Key systems typically include email, Slack, Gusto, and role-specific platforms. Review the Systems Doc in the Essential Resources section and contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net if you encounter any setup issues.

faq.question: Are there specific documentation requirements I need to follow?
faq.answer: Documentation requirements are outlined in the Fountain Professional Standards document. This includes patient documentation, communication records, and administrative documentation. All team members must follow these requirements to ensure compliance and quality of care. Review the Professional Standards document for detailed guidelines.

faq.question: What should I do if I have questions about the contractor policies?
faq.answer: If you have questions about the Fountain Contractor Policies, first review the complete document in the Essential Resources section. For clarification or specific situations not covered in the document, contact HR at hr@fountain.net. It's important to understand these policies as they govern your work relationship with Fountain.

faq.question: How will I be paid as a contractor?
faq.answer: Payment terms and schedules are detailed in the Fountain Contractor Policies document. This includes information about payment frequency, methods, and any required documentation. Review the Contractor Policies document in the Essential Resources section for complete payment details. For payment questions, contact HR at hr@fountain.net.

faq.question: What are my responsibilities regarding patient confidentiality?
faq.answer: Patient confidentiality is a critical component of the Fountain Professional Standards. All team members must maintain strict confidentiality of patient information in accordance with HIPAA regulations. The Professional Standards document outlines specific requirements for handling patient data, communication, and documentation. Review this document carefully and contact HR at hr@fountain.net with any questions.

faq.question: What should I do if I can't access a system I need for my work?
faq.answer: If you're unable to access a required system, first check the Systems Doc in the Essential Resources section for troubleshooting steps and access requirements. If the issue persists, contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net with details about the system, your role, and any error messages you're seeing. For urgent access needs, you can also reach out to Daniel Raphael on Slack.

faq.question: Are there specific quality standards I need to meet in my work?
faq.answer: Yes, Fountain maintains high quality standards for all work performed. The Fountain Professional Standards document outlines quality expectations, performance metrics, and standards for patient care and service delivery. All team members are expected to meet these standards consistently. Review the Professional Standards document for detailed requirements.

faq.question: What happens if I need to terminate my contractor relationship with Fountain?
faq.answer: Termination procedures and notice requirements are outlined in the Fountain Contractor Policies document. This includes information about notice periods, final payment, and return of company property. Review the Contractor Policies document for complete details. If you're considering termination, contact HR at hr@fountain.net to discuss the process.

faq.question: How do I report a compliance or ethical concern?
faq.answer: If you have a compliance or ethical concern, refer to the Fountain Professional Standards document for reporting procedures. You can also contact HR at hr@fountain.net or reach out to your manager. Fountain takes compliance and ethical concerns seriously and has procedures in place to address them confidentially.

faq.question: What training or certifications do I need to maintain?
faq.answer: Training and certification requirements vary by role and are detailed in the Fountain Professional Standards document. This includes required licenses, continuing education, and role-specific training. Review the Professional Standards document and your role-specific day one checklist for your specific requirements. Contact HR at hr@fountain.net with questions about certification maintenance.

faq.question: How do I request access to additional systems or tools?
faq.answer: To request access to additional systems or tools, first review the Systems Doc to understand available systems and their purposes. Then contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net with your request, including your role, the system you need, and the business justification. Your manager may need to approve certain access requests.

faq.question: What are the expectations for work hours and availability?
faq.answer: Work hours and availability expectations are outlined in the Fountain Contractor Policies document. This includes information about scheduled hours, on-call requirements (if applicable), and communication expectations. Review the Contractor Policies document for your specific role requirements. Contact HR at hr@fountain.net with questions about scheduling.

faq.question: How should I handle conflicts of interest?
faq.answer: Conflicts of interest policies are detailed in the Fountain Professional Standards document. All team members must disclose any potential conflicts of interest. Review the Professional Standards document for complete guidelines and disclosure procedures. If you have questions about a potential conflict, contact HR at hr@fountain.net.

faq.question: What security measures do I need to follow when using company systems?
faq.answer: Security requirements and best practices are outlined in the Systems Doc. This includes password policies, two-factor authentication, secure access methods, and data protection requirements. All team members must follow these security protocols. Review the Systems Doc for detailed security guidelines and contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net with security concerns.

faq.question: Can I work for other companies while contracting with Fountain?
faq.answer: Non-compete and exclusivity requirements are detailed in the Fountain Contractor Policies document. Review this document carefully to understand any restrictions on working with other companies. If you have questions about your specific situation, contact HR at hr@fountain.net for clarification.

faq.question: What should I do if I make an error in patient documentation?
faq.answer: Error correction procedures for patient documentation are outlined in the Fountain Professional Standards document. It's important to follow proper correction protocols to maintain accurate records and compliance. Review the Professional Standards document for correction procedures. If you're unsure how to correct an error, contact your manager or HR at hr@fountain.net.

faq.question: How do I stay updated on system changes and new tools?
faq.answer: The Systems Doc is regularly updated with information about system changes and new tools. Check this document periodically for updates. You'll also receive notifications about significant system changes through company communications. For questions about system updates, contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net.

faq.question: What are the expectations for professional boundaries with patients?
faq.answer: Professional boundaries with patients are a critical component of the Fountain Professional Standards. The document outlines appropriate boundaries, communication guidelines, and ethical considerations when interacting with patients. All team members must maintain appropriate professional boundaries. Review the Professional Standards document for detailed guidelines.

faq.question: What happens if I need to take time off or have scheduling conflicts?
faq.answer: Time off and scheduling policies for contractors are outlined in the Fountain Contractor Policies document. This includes procedures for requesting time off, handling scheduling conflicts, and coverage requirements. Review the Contractor Policies document for your specific role's requirements. Contact HR at hr@fountain.net or your manager with scheduling questions.

faq.question: How do I ensure I'm following all compliance requirements?
faq.answer: Compliance requirements are detailed across multiple documents. Review the Fountain Contractor Policies, Fountain Professional Standards, and Systems Doc for comprehensive compliance information. These documents cover legal requirements, regulatory compliance, and company policies. If you have compliance questions, contact HR at hr@fountain.net.

faq.question: What should I do if I suspect a system security breach?
faq.answer: If you suspect a security breach, immediately contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net and your manager. Do not attempt to investigate on your own. Security incident procedures are outlined in the Systems Doc. Report any suspicious activity, unauthorized access, or potential data breaches immediately.

faq.question: What information should I include when requesting system access?
faq.answer: When requesting system access, provide your full name, role, email address, the specific system or tool you need access to, and a business justification for why you need access. The Systems Doc outlines the standard access request process. Submit requests to IT Support at it-support@fountain.net. Some systems may require manager approval.

faq.question: How do I handle patient complaints or concerns?
faq.answer: Patient complaint procedures are outlined in the Fountain Professional Standards document. This includes how to document complaints, when to escalate issues, and appropriate response protocols. All team members should be familiar with these procedures to ensure patient concerns are addressed promptly and appropriately. Review the Professional Standards document for detailed guidelines.

faq.question: What are the requirements for maintaining my professional license?
faq.answer: License maintenance requirements vary by profession and state. The Fountain Professional Standards document provides general guidance, but you are responsible for maintaining your own professional licenses and certifications according to your licensing board's requirements. Keep HR informed of your license status and renewal dates. Contact HR at hr@fountain.net with questions about license documentation.

faq.question: How should I handle situations where I'm unsure about a policy or procedure?
faq.answer: If you're unsure about a policy or procedure, first consult the relevant document (Fountain Contractor Policies, Fountain Professional Standards, or Systems Doc) in the Essential Resources section. If you still have questions, contact your manager or HR at hr@fountain.net. It's better to ask for clarification than to make assumptions that could lead to policy violations.

faq.question: What should I do if I need to update my contact information or personal details?
faq.answer: Keep your contact information and personal details up to date in Gusto and notify HR at hr@fountain.net of any changes. This includes address, phone number, emergency contacts, and banking information. The Fountain Contractor Policies document outlines what information must be kept current. Prompt updates ensure you receive important communications and payments correctly.

faq.question: Are there specific requirements for how I should communicate with patients?
faq.answer: Yes, patient communication requirements are detailed in the Fountain Professional Standards document. This includes appropriate tone, language, response times, documentation requirements, and privacy considerations. All patient communications must comply with HIPAA regulations. Review the Professional Standards document for comprehensive communication guidelines.

faq.question: What happens if I need to change my work schedule or availability?
faq.answer: Schedule change procedures are outlined in the Fountain Contractor Policies document. Contact your manager and HR at hr@fountain.net to discuss schedule changes. Approval may be required depending on your role and team needs. Review the Contractor Policies document for your specific role's scheduling requirements and notice periods.

faq.question: How do I know which systems I'm authorized to use for my role?
faq.answer: The Systems Doc lists all available systems and their purposes. Your role-specific access will be determined during onboarding. If you're unsure about your access level or need clarification on which systems you should be using, review the Systems Doc and contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net. Your manager can also help clarify role-specific system requirements.

faq.question: What should I do if I receive a request that seems to violate company policies?
faq.answer: If you receive a request that seems to violate company policies, do not proceed with the request. Consult the Fountain Contractor Policies or Fountain Professional Standards documents to confirm. If you're still uncertain, contact HR at hr@fountain.net or your manager for guidance. Fountain has procedures in place to address policy concerns confidentially.

faq.question: How often should I review the company policy documents?
faq.answer: You should review the Fountain Contractor Policies, Fountain Professional Standards, and Systems Doc during your first week and whenever they are updated. These documents are living documents that may change, so check them periodically. You'll receive notifications about significant policy updates. Always refer to the most current versions in the Essential Resources section.

faq.question: What are the expectations for continuing education and professional development?
faq.answer: Continuing education and professional development requirements are outlined in the Fountain Professional Standards document. Requirements vary by role and may include maintaining certifications, completing training courses, and staying current with industry best practices. Review the Professional Standards document for your specific requirements and contact HR at hr@fountain.net with questions.

faq.question: How should I handle technical issues that prevent me from completing my work?
faq.answer: If technical issues prevent you from completing work, first check the Systems Doc for troubleshooting steps. If the issue persists, contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net immediately with details about the problem, error messages, and what you were trying to do. For urgent issues affecting patient care, also notify your manager. Document the issue and any workarounds you've attempted.

faq.question: What information is considered confidential and how should I protect it?
faq.answer: Confidential information includes patient data, company financial information, proprietary processes, and other sensitive information. The Fountain Professional Standards document outlines what constitutes confidential information and how to protect it. This includes secure storage, proper disposal, and restrictions on sharing. All team members must follow these confidentiality requirements. Review the Professional Standards document for detailed guidelines.

faq.question: Can I use my personal devices for work purposes?
faq.answer: Device usage policies are outlined in the Systems Doc. Personal device usage for work may be permitted with certain security requirements, such as encryption and secure access methods. Review the Systems Doc for specific device policies and security requirements. Contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net if you need to use personal devices for work to ensure compliance with security policies.

faq.question: What should I do if I notice a potential compliance issue or policy violation?
faq.answer: If you notice a potential compliance issue or policy violation, report it according to the procedures outlined in the Fountain Professional Standards document. You can report concerns to HR at hr@fountain.net or your manager. Fountain takes compliance seriously and has confidential reporting procedures. Do not ignore potential violations, as they could affect patient care or company operations.

faq.question: How do I access historical information or past documentation?
faq.answer: Access to historical information and documentation depends on the system. The Systems Doc provides information about how to access archived or historical data in various systems. If you need access to specific historical information, contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net with details about what you need and why. Some historical data may have restricted access for privacy or security reasons.

faq.question: What are the requirements for documenting my work and interactions?
faq.answer: Documentation requirements are detailed in the Fountain Professional Standards document. This includes what must be documented, documentation standards, timeliness requirements, and proper documentation formats. Accurate and timely documentation is essential for patient care, compliance, and quality assurance. Review the Professional Standards document for comprehensive documentation guidelines.

faq.question: How should I handle situations where policies seem to conflict?
faq.answer: If you encounter a situation where policies seem to conflict, first review all relevant documents (Fountain Contractor Policies, Fountain Professional Standards, and Systems Doc) to ensure you understand each policy correctly. If a conflict still exists, contact HR at hr@fountain.net for clarification. In general, patient safety and HIPAA compliance take precedence, followed by company policies.

faq.question: What support is available if I'm struggling with a system or process?
faq.answer: Multiple support resources are available. For technical issues, contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net. For policy or procedure questions, contact HR at hr@fountain.net. For urgent matters, contact Daniel Raphael on Slack. The Systems Doc also contains troubleshooting guides and FAQs. Don't hesitate to ask for help - Fountain is committed to supporting team members in their roles.

glossary.definition: Nurse Practitioner - Advanced practice registered nurses who provide primary and specialty healthcare.
Registered Nurse - Licensed healthcare professionals who provide patient care and coordinate treatment plans.
Customer Support - Team members who assist patients and handle customer inquiries.
Medical Assistant - Healthcare professionals who perform administrative and clinical tasks.
Human Resources Information System - Software system for managing employee data and HR processes.
Learning Management System - Platform for delivering and tracking training courses.
Paid Time Off - Vacation days, sick days, and personal time that employees can use.
Employee Assistance Program - Confidential counseling and support services available to employees and their families.
Retirement savings plan that allows employees to contribute a portion of their salary on a pre-tax basis.
Flexible Spending Account - Pre-tax account for eligible healthcare or dependent care expenses.
Health Savings Account - Tax-advantaged savings account for qualified medical expenses, available with high-deductible health plans.
Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act - Allows employees to continue health insurance coverage after leaving employment.
Wage and Tax Statement - Form provided annually showing total earnings and taxes withheld for the year.
Employee's Withholding Certificate - Form used to determine how much federal income tax to withhold from paychecks.
Employment Eligibility Verification form - Required for all new employees to verify identity and work authorization.
Non-Disclosure Agreement - Legal agreement to protect confidential company information.
Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act - Federal law protecting patient health information privacy.

firstDayChecklist.task: Set up email and company accounts

NPs.task: Download slack on your computer and mobile phone (go to www.slack.com)
Update your slack & intercom profiles by adding your picture
Complete the Abyde training: (look for the email from Abyde)
Complete the Akute Identity proofing setup (Check Slack DM)
Please send us a professional photo of you for your Doxy profile
Please send us a scanned copy of your ID: Front and Back
Please complete the direct deposit setup
Please send a copy of your licenses + DEA (if applicable), NPI number
Please provide contact number, address, and time zone information

CS.task: Refer to this training guide for relevant training
